AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being smuggled in relation to Maria De Jesus Garcia's case, potentially hidden in a pickup truck camper with fogged windows, appearing unwashed and unkempt, including Mexican citizens and illegal aliens found during an immigration inspection on Interstate Highway 35, exhibiting efforts to avoid detection, described as dirty appearing Hispanic-descended workmen
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographic boundary relevant to smuggling, considered in determining the legality of stops by roving United States Border Patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck cam: vehicle used for transporting illegal aliens, with heavily loaded appearance and fogged windows, driven at an unusually slow speed, suspected to contain contraband and undocumented aliens, stopped by United States Border Patrol on Interstate Highway 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency stopping Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge TATE: dissenting judge in the case of United States v. Garcia, questioning the lawfulness of the stop based on speculation about poor and dirty Hispanic appearing persons being Mexican aliens
